title: Shimeng Huang
text:
Hi, my name is Shimeng. I’m a postdoctoral fellow at the Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA) working with Francesco Locatello (Causal Learning and Artificial Intelligence, CLAI) and Matthew Robinson (Medical Genomics). I obtained my PhD in Statistics from the University of Copenhagen under the supervision of Niklas Pfister and Jonas Peters where I was a member of the Copenhagen Causality Lab (CoCaLa).


News

🎉 I successfully defended my PhD on Feb. 7, 2025!
📙 I submitted my PhD thesis on Dec. 8, 2024 and it is now publicly available!
🧬 I completed a research internship at Novo Nordisk (Apr.-Aug. 2024) in Copenhagen, Denmark.
💡 I finished a data scientist internship with Google France (Sep.-Nov. 2023) in Paris, France.

Personal background
I was born and raised in Tianjin, China, and my name in Chinese characters is 黄诗萌. In September 2012, I moved to Beijing to start my undergraduate study at Beijing Jiaotong University. In July 2014, I continued my study at the University of Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. After spending some enjoyable years there and in the Greater Toronto Area (Mississauga and Toronto, specifically) for study and work, I decided to move to Copenhagen, Denmark, to pursue my PhD degree in September 2021. I now live in Vienna, Austria.
